definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Yet they were three fine, well-set fellows enough.
sentences.chinese: 但是，兄弟三個關係不錯，手足之情牢不可破。

sentences.english: The white man was much slower about admitting the common brotherhood of man.
sentences.chinese: 白人反而較慢才能承認這種人類手足之情。

sentences.english: You cannot further the brotherhood of man by inciting class hatred.
sentences.chinese: 煽動階級仇恨不能夠增進人類的手足之情。

sentences.english: The rituals and celebrations of the Brotherhood of the Holy Spirit are attended by thousands of people.
sentences.chinese: 每次有幾千人參加聖靈手足之情的慶典儀式。

definition: blood is thicker than water/fig. family ties are closer than social relations
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
lit. the cow licking its calf fondly (idiom)/fig. to show deep affection towards one's children
close kindred slaughter one another (idiom); internecine strife
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
